snippet: National Harbor, a minicity in the Maryland suburbs of Washington, could soon be home to a large casino. But voters must first approve a gambling measure on November’s ballot.
abstract: National Harbor, a minicity in the Maryland suburbs of Washington, could soon be home to a large casino if the project's developer Peterson Company gets its way and voters approve a gambling measure on the ballot; high-stakes battle pits local interests as well as casino giants and political opponents against one another.
lead_paragraph: National Harbor, a minicity in the Maryland suburbs of Washington, could soon be home to a large casino. But voters must first approve a gambling measure on November’s ballot.

headline.main: Near Washington, a Casino Plan Awaits the Voters
headline.print_headline: Near Washington, Casino Plan Awaits the Voters
